sub_topic: Using the power rule to differentiate functions
message_1: Find the derivative of the function f(x) = 5x^6 using the power rule of differentiation.
message_2:
The power rule of differentiation states that if f(x) = x^n, where n is a constant, then the derivative f'(x) = nx^(n-1).

In this case, f(x) = 5x^6, so n = 6. Applying the power rule, we get:

f'(x) = 6 * 5x^(6-1) = 30x^5

So, the derivative of the function f(x) = 5x^6 is f'(x) = 30x^5.
